TITLE: Using Buffer with resizable ArrayBuffer in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how Buffer now correctly changes length when the underlying ArrayBuffer size is modified using the resize method.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
const ab = new ArrayBuffer(10, { maxByteLength: 20 });
const buffer = Buffer.from(ab);
console.log(buffer.byteLength);
10;
ab.resize(15);
console.log(buffer.byteLength);
15;
ab.resize(5);
console.log(buffer.byteLength);
5;

TITLE: Importing JSON modules with experimental import assertions in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the new experimental import assertions syntax to import JSON modules in Node.js ESM. This feature requires the --experimental-json-modules CLI flag.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
import info from `./package.json` assert { type: `json` };

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:

TITLE: Buffer Operation Vulnerability Examples in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Code examples demonstrating Buffer.fill() and Buffer.alloc() operations that can cause system hangs and denial of service vulnerabilities. These operations were later patched to zero fill instead of hanging.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
Buffer.alloc(100).fill(Buffer.alloc(0))
Buffer.alloc(100).fill(Buffer.from(''))
Buffer.alloc(100).fill(new Uint8Array([]))
Buffer.alloc(100, Buffer.alloc(0))
Buffer.alloc(100, new Uint8Array([]))
new Buffer(10).fill(new Buffer(''))

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding oaepHash Option for RSA-OAEP in Crypto Module
DESCRIPTION: Adds an oaepHash option to asymmetric encryption, allowing users to specify a hash function when using OAEP padding.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
crypto.publicEncrypt({
  key: publicKey,
  padding: crypto.constants.RSA_PKCS1_OAEP_PADDING,
  oaepHash: 'sha256'
}, buffer)

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using New Rolling Hash Functionality
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the new Hash.prototype.copy() method to clone a Hash object and compute intermediate digests

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Calculate a rolling hash.
const crypto = require('crypto');
const hash = crypto.createHash('sha256');

hash.update('one');
console.log(hash.copy().digest('hex'));

hash.update('two');
console.log(hash.copy().digest('hex'));

hash.update('three');
console.log(hash.copy().digest('hex'));

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding cached data options to vm.Script in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Introduces new 'produceCachedData' and 'cachedData' options to vm.Script to interact with V8's code cache for faster script instantiation.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const script = new vm.Script('Math.random()', { produceCachedData: true });
console.log(script.cachedData); // Buffer with V8's code cache data

const cachedScript = new vm.Script('Math.random()', { cachedData: script.cachedData });

TITLE: Node.js Download Page Structure in JSX/Markdown
DESCRIPTION: A template structure combining Markdown frontmatter with JSX components to create an interactive download page for Node.js. Includes custom components for version selection, operating system detection, and download options.

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
---
layout: download
title: Download Node.js®
---

<section>

Get Node.js® <Release.VersionDropdown /> for <Release.OperatingSystemDropdown /> using <Release.InstallationMethodDropdown /> with <Release.PackageManagerDropdown />

<Release.ReleaseCodeBox />

<Release.Provider>

Or get a prebuilt Node.js® for <Release.OperatingSystemDropdown /> running a <Release.PlatformDropdown /> architecture.

<Release.PrebuiltDownloadButtons />

</Release.Provider>

</section>

<section>

Read the <Release.ChangelogLink>changelog</Release.ChangelogLink> for this version.

Read the <Release.BlogPostLink>blog post</Release.BlogPostLink> for this version.

Learn how to <LinkWithArrow href="https://github.com/nodejs/node#verifying-binaries">verify</LinkWithArrow> signed SHASUMS.

Looking for Node.js source? Download a signed <Release.DownloadLink kind="source">Node.js source</Release.DownloadLink> tarball.

Check out our <LinkWithArrow href="https://nodejs.org/download/nightly/">nightly</LinkWithArrow> binaries or
all <LinkWithArrow href="https://nodejs.org/download/release/">previous releases</LinkWithArrow>
or the <LinkWithArrow href="https://unofficial-builds.nodejs.org/download/">unofficial</LinkWithArrow> binaries for other platforms.

</section>

TITLE: Promisifying fs.exists() with util.promisify()
DESCRIPTION: The fs.exists() function now works correctly with util.promisify(), allowing for Promise-based usage of the file existence check.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const util = require('util');
const fs = require('fs');

const existsAsync = util.promisify(fs.exists);

async function checkFileExists(path) {
  const exists = await existsAsync(path);
  console.log(`File ${path} exists: ${exists}`);
}

checkFileExists('./example.txt');

TITLE: Adding AbortController support to readline.question
DESCRIPTION: Adds support for passing an AbortController to readline.question to allow aborting the question.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const readline = require('readline');
const { AbortController } = require('abort-controller');

const rl = readline.createInterface({
  input: process.stdin,
  output: process.stdout
});

const controller = new AbortController();
const { signal } = controller;

rl.question('Enter something: ', { signal }, (answer) => {
  console.log('Answer:', answer);
});

// Abort question
controller.abort();

TITLE: HTTP Server Performance Benchmarks - Node.js v0.8.0 vs v0.6.19
DESCRIPTION: HTTP server benchmark results comparing request handling performance between Node.js v0.8.0 and v0.6.19 for different payload sizes.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
$ TYPE=bytes LENGTH=123 bash benchmark/http.sh  2>&1 | grep Req
# 0.6.19
Requests per second:    3317.24 [#/sec] (mean)
# 0.8.0
Requests per second:    3795.34 [#/sec] (mean) +14.41%

$ TYPE=bytes LENGTH=1024 bash benchmark/http.sh  2>&1 | grep Req
# v0.6.19
Requests per second:    3258.42 [#/sec] (mean)
# 0.8.0
Requests per second:    3585.62 [#/sec] (mean) +10.04%

TITLE: Accessing SEA Assets in Application Code
DESCRIPTION: Using the SEA API to access embedded assets at runtime

LANGUAGE: cjs
CODE:
const { getAsset } = require('node:sea');
// Returns a copy of the data in an ArrayBuffer
const image = getAsset('a.jpg');
// Returns a string decoded from the asset as UTF8.
const text = getAsset('b.txt', 'utf8');
// Returns a Blob containing the asset without copying.
const blob = getAssetAsBlob('a.jpg');

DESCRIPTION: Changes crypto module to use system CAs instead of bundled ones.

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copying Arguments Object in Node.js Core
DESCRIPTION: Modified internal Node.js code to copy the arguments object instead of leaking it.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Before
function foo() {
  bar(arguments);
}

// After 
function foo() {
  bar(Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments));
}

CODE:

v8::Local<v8::Object> fs = internalBinding("fs");

}

TITLE: Demonstrating WebAssembly memory allocation error
DESCRIPTION: Shows an example of the error that occurs when trying to allocate WebAssembly memory with limited virtual memory.

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
$ ulimit -v 5000000
$ node -p "new WebAssembly.Memory({ initial: 10, maximum: 100 });"
[eval]:1
new WebAssembly.Memory({ initial: 10, maximum: 100 });
^

RangeError: WebAssembly.Memory(): could not allocate memory
    at [eval]:1:1
    at runScriptInThisContext (node:internal/vm:209:10)
    at node:internal/process/execution:118:14
    at [eval]-wrapper:6:24
    at runScript (node:internal/process/execution:101:62)
    at evalScript (node:internal/process/execution:136:3)
    at node:internal/main/eval_string:49:3

TITLE: Handling Unhandled Error Events in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: For unhandled 'error' events with an argument that is not an Error object, the resulting exception will now have more information about the argument.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
process.on('uncaughtException', (err) => {
  console.log(err); // Will now contain more information if not an Error object
});

TITLE: Using test plans in test_runner
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the new test plan feature in the test_runner module to specify the expected number of assertions and subtests.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
test('top level test', t => {
  t.plan(2);
  t.assert.ok('some relevant assertion here');
  t.subtest('subtest', () => {});
});

Check out our <LinkWithArrow href="https://nodejs.org/download/nightly/">nightly</LinkWithArrow> binaries or
all <LinkWithArrow href="https://nodejs.org/download/release/">previous releases</LinkWithArrow>
or the <LinkWithArrow href="https://unofficial-builds.nodejs.org/download/">unofficial</LinkWithArrow> binaries for other platforms.

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exposing workers by default
DESCRIPTION: Removes the --experimental-worker flag, making worker threads available by default.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const { Worker, isMainThread, parentPort } = require('worker_threads');

if (isMainThread) {
  const worker = new Worker(__filename);
  worker.on('message', (msg) => console.log(msg));
} else {
  parentPort.postMessage('Hello from worker!');
}

TITLE: Adding Corepack to Node.js Dependencies

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Add corepack to dependencies
[`737df75e17`] - **(SEMVER-MINOR)** **deps**: add corepack (Maël Nison) [#39608](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/39608)

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fleet Help Command Output
DESCRIPTION: Output of Fleet's help command showing available commands and usage information.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
fleet help
Usage: fleet <command> [<args>]

The commands are:
  deploy   Push code to drones.
  drone    Connect to a hub as a worker.
  exec     Run commands on drones.
  hub      Create a hub for drones to connect.
  monitor  Show service events system-wide.
  ps       List the running processes on the drones.
  remote   Manage the set of remote hubs.
  spawn    Run services on drones.
  stop     Stop processes running on drones.

For help about a command, try `fleet help`.

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using URL.canParse API in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the new URL.canParse API to validate if a URL string can be parsed correctly according to WHATWG URL specification. The method takes an input string and an optional base URL.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
const isValid = URL.canParse('/foo', 'https://example.org/'); // true
const isNotValid = URL.canParse('/foo'); // false

TITLE: mainModule.__proto__ Policy Bypass (CVE-2023-30581)
DESCRIPTION: Code pattern demonstrating the vulnerability where process.mainModule.__proto__.require() can bypass Node.js policy mechanism restrictions. This affects experimental policy features in Node.js versions 16.x, 18.x, and 20.x.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
process.mainModule.__proto__.require()

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding autoSelectFamily global getter and setter in Net module
DESCRIPTION: Adds new global getter and setter methods for autoSelectFamily in the Net module. This allows configuring automatic family selection for network connections.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
net.autoSelectFamily = true;
const value = net.autoSelectFamily;

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Example of using an empty string as the prefix for temporary directory names in the fs module.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
fs.mkdtemp('', (err, folder) => {
  // folder will be a unique temporary directory
});

view.set([1, 2, 3, 4]);
console.log(util.inspect(buf));

TITLE: Adding oaepLabel option to crypto module
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new oaepLabel option to the crypto module

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
crypto.publicEncrypt({
  key: publicKey,
  padding: crypto.constants.RSA_PKCS1_OAEP_PADDING,
  oaepHash: 'sha256',
  oaepLabel: Buffer.from('label')
}, data)

DESCRIPTION: Ensures Stream.pipeline re-throws errors when no callback is provided.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Fix Stream.pipeline error handling
stream.pipeline(source, destination, (err) => {
  // Error handling
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: URL Resolution in io.js 1.3.0
DESCRIPTION: Updated URL resolution behavior in io.js 1.3.0 that properly handles trailing slashes when resolving relative paths.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
url.resolve('/path/to/file', '.') // Returns '/path/to/'
url.resolve('/', '.') // Returns '/'

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding buffer.isUtf8 for UTF-8 Validation
DESCRIPTION: A new buffer.isUtf8 method has been added for UTF-8 validation, improving string handling capabilities.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const buffer = Buffer.from('Hello, world!');
console.log(buffer.isUtf8()); // true

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fixing fs.writeFileSync regression in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This commit fixes a regression introduced in v21.3.0 that caused fs.writeFileSync to throw when called with 'utf8' encoding, no flag option, and if the target file didn't exist yet.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
fs.writeFileSync(file, data, { encoding: 'utf8' });

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Makes the Symbol.toStringTag property of the Node.js process object writable again.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
process[Symbol.toStringTag] = 'Process';

DESCRIPTION: Modified fs module options handling to allow prototype properties to apply by removing hasOwnProperty() check in options object properties.

CODE:
hasOwnProperty()

TITLE: Enhancing Buffer.from() performance in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Performance improvement for Buffer.from() by approximately 50%.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
Buffer.from(array)

----------------------------------------

TITLE: DNS Resolution Options
DESCRIPTION: Adds new DNS resolution options for tries and result order

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
// Configure DNS resolution tries
dns.resolve('nodejs.org', { tries: 3 });

DESCRIPTION: This change moves the package resolver functionality from JavaScript to C++, potentially improving performance of package resolution in Node.js.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
// From commit 45e4f82912
// Move package resolver to C++

TITLE: npm Path Listing Format
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to list package paths in a flat format using the -p flag, useful for piping to other programs

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
$ npm ls -p
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm/node_modules/semver
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm/node_modules/ronn
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm/node_modules/ronn/node_modules/opts
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm/node_modules/express
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm/node_modules/express/node_modules/connect
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm/node_modules/express/node_modules/connect/node_modules/qs
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm/node_modules/express/node_modules/connect/node_modules/mime
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm/node_modules/express/node_modules/mime
/Users/isaacs/dev-src/js/npm/node_modules/express/node_modules/qs

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
---
date: '2016-06-16T12:00:00.000Z'
category: weekly
title: Weekly Update - June 16th, 2016
layout: blog-post
author: 'Minwoo Jung (github.com/JungMinu)'

TITLE: Using util.promisify() for callback APIs
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating the new util.promisify() API that allows standard Node.js callback-style APIs to be wrapped in Promises

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const fs = require('fs');
const util = require('util');

const readfile = util.promisify(fs.readFile);

readfile('/some/file')
  .then(data => {
    /** ... **/
  })
  .catch(err => {
    /** ... **/
  });

----------------------------------------

- Merge `run` and `exit` methods (Andrey Pechkurov) [#31950]
- Prevent sync methods of async storage exiting outer context (Stephen Belanger) [#31950]

TITLE: Using the --run CLI flag
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to use the now-stable --run CLI flag to execute a script from package.json.

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
{
  "scripts": {
    "test": "node --test-reporter junit --test ./test"
  }
}

TITLE: Improving Inspection of Boxed Symbols in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Enhances the inspection of boxed symbols to be consistent with other primitives.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
util.inspect(Object(Symbol()))

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Promise Triggers in Async Hooks
DESCRIPTION: When one Promise leads to the creation of a new Promise, the parent Promise will be identified as the trigger in async hooks.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Example usage:
const asyncHooks = require('async_hooks');

asyncHooks.createHook({
  init(asyncId, type, triggerAsyncId) {
    console.log(`Promise ${asyncId} created by ${triggerAsyncId}`);
  }
}).enable();

Promise.resolve().then(() => new Promise(() => {}));

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding hasRef() Method to MessagePort
DESCRIPTION: This commit adds the hasRef() method to the MessagePort class in the worker module, allowing users to check if the port is currently referenced.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const { MessageChannel } = require('worker_threads');
const { port1, port2 } = new MessageChannel();

console.log(port1.hasRef()); // Check if port1 is referenced

----------------------------------------

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
- **deps**: upgrade npm to 6.14.9 (Myles Borins) [#36450]

TITLE: Buffer Allocation Code Example - Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating the buffer initialization vulnerability (CVE-2017-15897) where buffers were not properly initialized when encoding mismatches occurred.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
Buffer.alloc(0x100, "This is not correctly encoded", "hex");

TITLE: Installing Node.js from source using nvm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs Node.js from source using nvm on Unix/OS X systems.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
env VERSION=`python tools/getnodeversion.py` make install DESTDIR=`nvm_version_path v$VERSION` PREFIX=""

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Python 3 Support for Building
DESCRIPTION: Enables building Node.js using Python 3 in addition to Python 2.

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
python3 configure
make

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Node.js Version Impact Matrix
DESCRIPTION: Lists the affected Node.js versions and their corresponding vulnerabilities

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
v19.x: 2 high severity (OpenSSL), 1 medium severity (DNS rebinding)
v18.x: 2 high severity (OpenSSL), 1 medium severity (DNS rebinding)
v16.x: 1 medium severity (DNS rebinding)
v14.x: 1 medium severity (DNS rebinding)

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Reporting ArrayBuffer memory in memoryUsage
DESCRIPTION: Adds reporting of ArrayBuffer memory to the process.memoryUsage() function

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const mem = process.memoryUsage();
console.log(mem.arrayBuffers);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exposing SSL_export_keying_material in TLS module
DESCRIPTION: Exposes the SSL_export_keying_material functionality in the TLS module.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const tls = require('tls');

// New method exposed on TLS socket
socket.exportKeyingMaterial(length, label, context);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Unsubscribe Method to Non-Active DC Channels
DESCRIPTION: Adds an unsubscribe method to non-active diagnostic channels, allowing users to unsubscribe from channels that are not currently active.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const dc = require('diagnostics_channel');
const channel = dc.channel('my-channel');
channel.unsubscribe(listener);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fixing Debug Break with Eval
DESCRIPTION: Fixed an issue where using --debug-brk and --eval together now works as expected.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// node --debug-brk --eval "console.log('Hello');"

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing clientCertEngine option in TLS
DESCRIPTION: Added a new clientCertEngine option to the TLS module to allow customization of certificate selection behavior.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Example usage of clientCertEngine option
tls.connect({
  clientCertEngine: 'custom_engine'
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extending V8 HeapStatistics with new fields
DESCRIPTION: The object returned by `v8.getHeapStatistics()` now includes three new fields: `malloced_memory`, `peak_malloced_memory`, and `does_zap_garbage`.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const v8 = require('v8');
const stats = v8.getHeapStatistics();
console.log(stats.malloced_memory);
console.log(stats.peak_malloced_memory);
console.log(stats.does_zap_garbage);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating c-ares to version 1.18.1
DESCRIPTION: The c-ares library is updated to version 1.18.1 to fix a regression in resolving CNAME records with underscores.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
"deps": update c-ares to 1.18.1 (Richard Lau) [#40660]

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Emitting 'ready' event for ReadStream and WriteStream
DESCRIPTION: The fs module now emits a 'ready' event for ReadStream and WriteStream objects.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const fs = require('fs');

const readStream = fs.createReadStream('file.txt');
readStream.on('ready', () => {
  console.log('ReadStream is ready');
});

const writeStream = fs.createWriteStream('output.txt');
writeStream.on('ready', () => {
  console.log('WriteStream is ready');
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Node.js installer on macOS using curl
DESCRIPTION: This command downloads the latest Node.js installer package for macOS using curl and installs it.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
curl "https://nodejs.org/dist/latest/$(curl -s https://nodejs.org/dist/latest/ | grep "pkg" | cut -d'"' -f 2)" -o "$HOME/Downloads/node-latest.pkg" && sudo installer -store -pkg "$HOME/Downloads/node-latest.pkg" -target "/"

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Storybook Story Template
DESCRIPTION: Template for creating Storybook stories with TypeScript support

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
import type { Meta as MetaObj, StoryObj } from '@storybook/react';
import NameOfComponent from '@components/PathTo/YourComponent';

type Story = StoryObj<typeof NameOfComponent>;
type Meta = MetaObj<typeof NameOfComponent>;

export const Default: Story = {};

export const AnotherStory: Story = {
  args: {},
};

export default { component: NameOfComponent } as Meta;

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deprecating invalid ports in url.parse
DESCRIPTION: The use of invalid ports in the url.parse function has been deprecated.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const url = require('url');
// Using invalid ports in url.parse is now deprecated

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding --import flag for ESM modules
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new --import command line flag to allow importing ESM modules when starting Node.js. This provides a way to execute module side effects on startup.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
node --import=./module.mjs

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Improving Windows Crash Reporting in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Adds stack frame names to crash reports on Windows when the node.pdb file is available.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
- [[`b4cdd478b9`](https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/b4cdd478b9)] - **src,win**: informative stack traces (Refael Ackermann) [#23822](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/23822)

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Allowing URL as cwd in child_process
DESCRIPTION: The options.cwd parameter in child_process methods can now receive a URL object. This is a minor addition to the child_process module.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const { spawn } = require('child_process');
spawn('command', [], { cwd: new URL('file:///path/to/cwd') });

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Node.js Version Vulnerability Status Table
DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive breakdown of which Node.js versions are affected by each security vulnerability, including CVE-2015-8027, CVE-2015-6764, and OpenSSL updates.

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
- Versions 0.10.x: Not affected by CVE-2015-8027 and CVE-2015-6764, may be vulnerable to OpenSSL issues
- Versions 0.12.x: Vulnerable to CVE-2015-8027, not affected by CVE-2015-6764, may be vulnerable to OpenSSL issues
- Versions 4.x (LTS Argon): Vulnerable to both CVE-2015-8027 and CVE-2015-6764, may be vulnerable to OpenSSL issues
- Versions 5.x: Vulnerable to both CVE-2015-8027 and CVE-2015-6764, may be vulnerable to OpenSSL issues

----------------------------------------

TITLE: SHA256 Checksums and GPG Signature Block
DESCRIPTION: SHA256 checksums and GPG signature verification data for the release files

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA256

ced5810b721cf1ffd97b3214e6e1749981928d7d787785ab6e93656c7eecef57  node-v14.15.2-aix-ppc64.tar.gz
...

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fixing Timer Cancellation Behavior
DESCRIPTION: Fixed an issue where re-canceling a cancelled timer would throw an error.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const timer = setTimeout(() => {}, 1000);
clearTimeout(timer);
clearTimeout(timer); // No longer throws

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fixing Buffer Creation from Zero-length ArrayBuffer in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Resolves an issue with creating Buffer instances from zero-length ArrayBuffers.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
Buffer.from(new ArrayBuffer(0))

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stabilizing AsyncLocalStorage in async_hooks
DESCRIPTION: Part of AsyncLocalStorage has been stabilized in this release. This change impacts the async_hooks module.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const { AsyncLocalStorage } = require('async_hooks');

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exposing process.ppid in the process module
DESCRIPTION: The process.ppid property is now exposed, allowing access to the parent process ID.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
console.log(`Parent process ID: ${process.ppid}`);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node.js 18 on CentOS/RHEL 8 and Fedora
DESCRIPTION: This command installs Node.js 18 on CentOS/RHEL 8 and Fedora.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
dnf module install nodejs:18/common

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
{
  "sideNavigation": {
    "learn": [
      {
        "label": "Sub-category",
        "items": {
          "article": {
            "link": "/learn/sub-category/article",
            "label": "components.navigation.learn.sub-category.article"
          }
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

DESCRIPTION: Adds support for tagging objects with specific types in the N-API.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
napi_status napi_type_tag_object(napi_env env,
                              napi_value js_object,
                              const napi_type_tag* type_tag);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing vm.measureMemory() for per-context memory measurement
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new vm.measureMemory() method to measure memory usage per VM context.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const vm = require('vm');

const context = vm.createContext({});

vm.measureMemory({ mode: 'detailed', execution: 'sync' }).then((result) => {
  console.log(result);
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding process.cpuUsage() method
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new process.cpuUsage() method to get CPU usage information.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const startUsage = process.cpuUsage();
// { user: 38579, system: 6986 }

// spin the CPU for 500 milliseconds
const now = Date.now();
while (Date.now() - now < 500);

console.log(process.cpuUsage(startUsage));
// { user: 514883, system: 11226 }

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making FIPS-related crypto options always available
DESCRIPTION: This change makes FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standards) related options in the crypto module always available, even when Node.js is not built with FIPS support.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const crypto = require('crypto');
// FIPS options now available regardless of build

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding --stack-trace-limit to NODE_OPTIONS
DESCRIPTION: Adds support for the --stack-trace-limit option in the NODE_OPTIONS environment variable.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
process.env.NODE_OPTIONS = '--stack-trace-limit=100';

TITLE: Implementing Node.js Events Page Layout in Markdown/HTML
DESCRIPTION: Front matter and structure definition for a Node.js events page that uses the 'about' layout template and includes a custom UpcomingMeetings component to display meeting information.

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
---
title: Upcoming Events
layout: about
---

## Upcoming Events

Node.js events are open and available to the public. Anyone is welcome to join and participate.

### Upcoming Node.js® Meetings

The Node.js project holds numerous meetings throughout the year to discuss and plan aspects of the project.

The following meetings are upcoming in the next 7 days.

<UpcomingMeetings />

TITLE: Adding JWK format option to keyObject.export() in crypto module
DESCRIPTION: Adds support for exporting keys in JWK (JSON Web Key) format using the keyObject.export() method in the crypto module.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const keyObject = crypto.createPublicKey(publicKey);
const jwk = keyObject.export({ format: 'jwk' });

layout: layout-name
---

TITLE: Subscribing to a diagnostics channel in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Example of subscribing to a named diagnostics channel

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const dc = require('diagnostics_channel');
const channel = dc.channel('mysql.query');

channel.subscribe(({ query, host }) => {
  console.log(`mysql query to ${host}: ${query}`);
});

const http = require('node:http');
'''

'''mjs
import http from 'node:http';
'''

TITLE: Preventing debug context inception in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Fix to avoid crashes when using util methods in the debugger by preventing debug context inception.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
if (env->context() == debug_context) {
  return;
}

TITLE: Adding fsPromises.watch() method in fs module
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new fsPromises.watch() method to the fs module for watching file system changes using promises.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const watcher = fs.promises.watch(filename);
for await (const event of watcher) {
  console.log(event);
}

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Improving HTTP Keep-Alive in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: When freeing a socket for reuse in keep-alive Agent, wait for both prefinish and end events to prevent parser errors.



----------------------------------------

TITLE: Upgrading OpenSSL in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Upgrades OpenSSL to version 1.0.2f and increases minimum Diffie-Hellman parameter size to mitigate Logjam attack.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
**openssl**: upgrade from 1.0.2e to 1.0.2f. To mitigate against the Logjam attack, TLS clients now reject Diffie-Hellman handshakes with parameters shorter than 1024-bits, up from the previous limit of 768-bits.

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing experimental pkg-exports proposal in ESM
DESCRIPTION: Added support for a new 'exports' field in package.json to provide custom subpath aliasing for ES modules. This is an experimental feature.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// package.json
{
  "exports": {
    "./submodule": "./src/submodule.js"
  }
}

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning the Node.js Website Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands for cloning the forked Node.js website repository using SSH, HTTPS, or GitHub CLI.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
git clone git@github.com:<YOUR_GITHUB_USERNAME>/nodejs.org.git # SSH
git clone https://github.com/<YOUR_GITHUB_USERNAME>/nodejs.org.git # HTTPS
gh repo clone <YOUR_GITHUB_USERNAME>/nodejs.org # GitHub CLI

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using the 'module-sync' exports condition in package.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to use the new 'module-sync' exports condition in a package.json file to support both ESM and CJS users during the transition period.

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
{
  "type": "module",
  "exports": {
    "node": {
      "module-sync": "./index.js",
      "default": "./dist/index.cjs"
    },
    "default": "./index.js"
  }
}

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Inspecting Object Constructor Name in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the updated behavior of util.inspect() in io.js v3.1.0, which now prints the constructor name of the object if present.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
util.inspect(obj)

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding AbortSignal support to dgram.createSocket
DESCRIPTION: Adds support for passing an AbortSignal to dgram.createSocket to allow aborting the socket creation.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const dgram = require('dgram');
const { AbortController } = require('abort-controller');

const controller = new AbortController();
const { signal } = controller;

const socket = dgram.createSocket({ type: 'udp4', signal });

// Abort socket creation
controller.abort();

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Changes child_process to use /system/bin/sh as the shell on Android systems.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
child_process: use /system/bin/sh on android (Ben Noordhuis) [#6745](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/6745)

DESCRIPTION: Command to install TypeScript locally as a dev dependency using npm.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
npm i -D typescript

TITLE: Demonstrating Implicit Behavior in Domain Module
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet illustrates how one indirectly linked module can affect another when using domains, potentially causing unexpected behavior and silent error swallowing.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
// module a.js
const b = require('./b');
const c = require('./c');

// module b.js
const d = require('domain').create();
d.on('error', () => {
  /* silence everything */
});
d.enter();

// module c.js
const dep = require('some-dep');
dep.method(); // Uh-oh! This method doesn't actually exist.

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Improving Buffer.from() Performance in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Optimizes the performance of Buffer.from(str, 'hex') and Buffer#write(str, 'hex') operations.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
Buffer.from(str, 'hex')

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
buffer.write(str, 'hex')

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Revoking Legacy Mode Deprecation in Assert Module
DESCRIPTION: The deprecation of legacy mode (DEP0089) in the assert module has been revoked.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Legacy mode is no longer deprecated
assert.equal(1, '1');

----------------------------------------

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Support pattern trailers for imports field
[`607bc74eae`] - **(SEMVER-MINOR)** **module**: support pattern trailers (Guy Bedford) [#39635](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/39635)

TITLE: Binding Inspector to Random Port
DESCRIPTION: It is now possible to bind the inspector to a random port using --inspect=0, useful for automated testing and environments where a specific port cannot be guaranteed.

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
node --inspect=0 app.js

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
switch to lazy init for zlib streams

TITLE: Filesystem Promise API Improvements
DESCRIPTION: Enhances fs Promises API with new features like empty prefix for temp directories

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
// Allow empty string for temp directory prefix
await fs.promises.mkdtemp('');

TITLE: Adding loop idle time to diagnostic report
DESCRIPTION: Adds the event loop idle time to the diagnostic report output.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const report = process.report.getReport();
console.log(report.javascriptHeap.totalHeapSize);
console.log(report.resourceUsage.fsActivity);
console.log(report.libuv.loopIdleTime); // New field

TITLE: Breaking Buffer Change Example
DESCRIPTION: Example showing the removal of deprecated 'raw' and 'raws' encoding types from Buffer

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// No longer supported in v5.0.0:
buffer.write('hello', 'raw')
buffer.toString('raws')

// Cleanup weak ref for sandbox and global proxy

TITLE: Fixing Windows Installer Localization in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This commit addresses a regression in the Windows installer for non-English locales introduced in Node.js 14.17.2. It uses the localized name for "Authenticated Users" to resolve the issue.

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
[[`0f00104a2c`](https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/0f00104a2c)] - **win,msi**: use localized "Authenticated Users" name (Richard Lau) [#39241](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/39241)

TITLE: Adding getPrompt method to readline
DESCRIPTION: Adds a getPrompt method to readline to get the current prompt string.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const readline = require('readline');

const rl = readline.createInterface({
  input: process.stdin,
  output: process.stdout,
  prompt: 'OHAI> '
});

console.log(rl.getPrompt()); // 'OHAI> '

----------------------------------------

n lts

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Renaming Atomics.wake to Atomics.notify in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Atomics.wake is being renamed to Atomics.notify in the ECMAScript specification. Node.js has added a notify alias and will emit a warning if wake is used.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Old usage (will emit warning)
Atomics.wake(sharedArray, index);

// New recommended usage
Atomics.notify(sharedArray, index);

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Addresses an issue with npm installation when using the --shared flag.

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
npm install --shared

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exposing v8::Isolate setup callbacks in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Exposes V8 Isolate setup callbacks, allowing for more fine-grained control over the V8 engine initialization. This is a SEMVER-MINOR change.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
// New API to set up V8 Isolate callbacks

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using new flush option in fs.writeFile
DESCRIPTION: A new 'flush' option has been added to fs.writeFile and related functions to force flushing data to permanent storage after writing.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
fs.writeFile('file.txt', 'data', { flush: true }, callback);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Load Testing with ApacheBench
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a new user and perform load testing on the authentication endpoint using ApacheBench.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
curl -X GET "http://localhost:8080/newUser?username=matt&password=password"
ab -k -c 20 -n 250 "http://localhost:8080/auth?username=matt&password=password"

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting local window size of HTTP/2 session
DESCRIPTION: Allows setting the local window size of an HTTP/2 session, which controls flow control.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const http2 = require('http2');

const server = http2.createServer();
server.on('session', (session) => {
  session.setLocalWindowSize(1024 * 1024); // Set to 1MB
});

----------------------------------------

<Release.ReleaseCodeBox />

<Release.Provider>

Or get a prebuilt Node.js® for <Release.OperatingSystemDropdown /> running a <Release.PlatformDropdown /> architecture.

<Release.PrebuiltDownloadButtons />

</Release.Provider>

</section>

assert.throws(
  () => {
    throw new Error('Wrong value');
  },
  Error
);

DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the new '**' operator to raise a number to a power, equivalent to Math.pow().

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
const maxInt = 2 ** 32 - 1; // Equivalent to: Math.pow(2, 32) - 1

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding AbortSignal support to http.request
DESCRIPTION: Adds support for using AbortSignal to abort HTTP requests made with http.request.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const controller = new AbortController();
const signal = controller.signal;

const req = http.request({
  hostname: 'example.com',
  signal
});

// Abort the request
controller.abort();

DESCRIPTION: Benchmark comparison between Node.js v0.4.12 and v0.6.0 on Linux systems, showing improvements in HTTP requests, I/O operations, and startup time.

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
|                            | v0.4.12 (linux) | v0.6.0 (linux) |
| -------------------------- | --------------- | -------------- |
| http_simple.js /bytes/1024 | 5461 r/s        | 6263 r/s       |
| io.js read                 | 19.75 mB/s      | 26.63 mB/s     |
| io.js write                | 21.60 mB/s      | 17.40 mB/s     |
| startup.js                 | 74.7 ms         | 49.6 ms        |

TITLE: Deprecating unsafe emit{Before,After} in async_hooks
DESCRIPTION: The unsafe emit{Before,After} methods in async_hooks are being deprecated.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Deprecated:
async_hooks.emitBefore();
async_hooks.emitAfter();

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Console groupIndentation option in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new groupIndentation option when creating a Console instance to customize group indentation width.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
const { Console } = require('console');
const customConsole = new Console({
  stdout: process.stdout,
  stderr: process.stderr,
  groupIndentation: 10,
});

customConsole.log('foo');
// 'foo'
customConsole.group();
customConsole.log('foo');
//           'foo'

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Root Certificates in Crypto Module
DESCRIPTION: Updates the root certificates in the crypto module to NSS 3.107.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
[[`36dd9ecc41`](https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/36dd9ecc41)] - **crypto**: update root certificates to NSS 3.107 (Node.js GitHub Bot) [#56566](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/56566)

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deprecating String Coercion in fs.write and fs.writeFileSync
DESCRIPTION: The string coercion behavior in fs.write and fs.writeFileSync methods has been deprecated. This change aims to improve consistency and prevent potential errors.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Deprecated usage (will show a warning)
fs.write(fd, 'hello', callback);
fs.writeFileSync('file.txt', 'hello');

// Recommended usage
fs.write(fd, Buffer.from('hello'), callback);
fs.writeFileSync('file.txt', Buffer.from('hello'));

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing REPL Module in ES Modules
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates importing the REPL module in an ES Modules JavaScript file.

LANGUAGE: mjs
CODE:
import repl from 'node:repl';

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Syncing Fork with Upstream and Pushing Changes
DESCRIPTION: Commands for syncing the local branch with upstream changes and pushing updates to the forked repository.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
git fetch upstream
git merge upstream/main

cd ~/nodejs.org
git add .
git commit -m "describe your changes"
git push -u origin name-of-your-branch

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Allowing Prevention of SetPromiseRejectCallback
DESCRIPTION: Allows preventing SetPromiseRejectCallback in the src module.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
allow preventing SetPromiseRejectCallback

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Shards Support to Test Runner in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Implements sharding support in the test runner, allowing for more efficient test distribution and parallel execution.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
test_runner.add shards support

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding EventEmitter.on() for async iteration
DESCRIPTION: New method added to EventEmitter to allow async iteration over events.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
for await (const event of emitter.on('event')) {
  console.log(event);
}

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Local vs Global Package Installation Example - Bash
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the difference in installation paths when installing packages from different working directories. Shows how npm intelligently determines the installation location based on the nearest node_modules directory.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
cd ~/projects/foo     # go into my project
npm install express   # ./node_modules/express
cd lib/utils          # move around in there
vim some-thing.js     # edit some stuff, work work work
npm install redis     # ./lib/utils/node_modules/redis!? ew.

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Fleet Remote Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Command to add a default remote configuration for Fleet, storing hub connection details locally.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
fleet remote add default --hub=x.x.x.x:7000 --secret=beepboop

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deprecation of worker.suicide in cluster module
DESCRIPTION: The worker.suicide method in the cluster module is deprecated and will emit a process warning. This method is being replaced with worker.exitedAfterDisconnect.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
worker.suicide; // Deprecated
worker.exitedAfterDisconnect; // New property to use instead

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding diagnostics channel for process and worker in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: A new diagnostics channel for process and worker has been added to the lib module. This is a minor semver change.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Example usage of the new diagnostics channel
// (Note: This is a conceptual example, actual implementation may vary)
const diagnosticsChannel = require('diagnostics_channel');
const processChannel = diagnosticsChannel.channel('process');
processChannel.subscribe((message) => {
  console.log('Process event:', message);
});

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Path and Environment Variables for Custom Installations
DESCRIPTION: This shell script snippet sets up PATH, LD_LIBRARY_PATH, CPATH, PKG_CONFIG_PATH, and MANPATH to include custom-installed software. It iterates through directories in $HOME/local to add relevant paths.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
PATH="$HOME/local/bin:/opt/local/bin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/opt/local/lib:/usr/local/lib:/usr/lib"
for i in $HOME/local/*; do
  [ -d $i/bin ] && PATH="${i}/bin:${PATH}"
  [ -d $i/sbin ] && PATH="${i}/sbin:${PATH}"
  [ -d $i/include ] && CPATH="${i}/include:${CPATH}"
  [ -d $i/lib ] && LD_LIBRARY_PATH="${i}/lib:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}"
  [ -d $i/lib/pkgconfig ] && PKG_CONFIG_PATH="${i}/lib/pkgconfig:${PKG_CONFIG_PATH}"
  [ -d $i/share/man ] && MANPATH="${i}/share/man:${MANPATH}"
done

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling VTune JIT Profiling Support in Node.js Build
DESCRIPTION: Adds support for Intel's VTune JIT profiling when Node.js is compiled with the --enable-vtune-profiling flag.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
--enable-vtune-profiling

TITLE: Verifying Node.js v0.11.14 Release Checksums
DESCRIPTION: PGP signed message containing SHA1 checksums for various Node.js v0.11.14 release files, including binaries and installers for different platforms.

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering and Generating Flame Graph for Specific Function
DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to filter stacks containing a particular function, collapse the DTrace output, and then generate a flame graph SVG from the filtered data.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
stackvis dtrace collapsed < stacks.out | grep SomeFunction > collapsed.out\nstackvis collapsed flamegraph-svg < collapsed.out > stacks.svg

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Unhandled Rejection Behavior Change
DESCRIPTION: Example showing the new default unhandled rejection behavior that throws instead of warning

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
// Will now throw instead of just warning
Promise.reject(new Error('error'));

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling TLS Trace in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: New method to enable TLS trace for debugging TLS/SSL connections. This can be used to troubleshoot TLS connection issues.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const tls = require('tls');
const socket = tls.TLSSocket();
socket.enableTrace();

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Flame Graph SVG from DTrace Output
DESCRIPTION: This command uses stackvis to convert the DTrace output (stacks.out) into an SVG flame graph (stacks.svg).

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
stackvis dtrace flamegraph-svg < stacks.out > stacks.svg

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling V8 Snapshots by Default
DESCRIPTION: Properly enables V8 snapshots by default, which were previously kept off due to a configuration error.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
v8_use_snapshot = true

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Shows the Git commit hash formatting style used throughout the release notes

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
\[[`285bb4ee14`](https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/285bb4ee14)] - **crypto**: update root certificates to NSS 3.107 (Node.js GitHub Bot) [#56566](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/56566)

DESCRIPTION: Adds IPv6 scope id suffix to received udp6 datagrams.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
add IPv6 scope id suffix to received udp6 dgrams

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
$ node --experimental-permission --allow-addons

TITLE: Installing stackvis Node Package
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the stackvis tool globally using npm. Stackvis is used to transform DTrace output into a flame graph.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
npm install -g stackvis

TITLE: Using the node:test Module

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const test = require('node:test');

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using import attributes instead of import assertions in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new 'with' keyword for import attributes to replace the deprecated 'assert' keyword for import assertions.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
import "foo" with { ... }

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using URL in Worker Constructor
DESCRIPTION: Allows passing a URL object to the Worker constructor

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
new Worker(new URL('worker.js', import.meta.url))

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating V8 to 6.2.414.32
DESCRIPTION: Node.js v9.0.0 updates the V8 JavaScript engine to version 6.2.414.32. This brings performance improvements and new language features.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// V8 6.2 adds support for async iterators
async function* asyncGenerator() {
  yield 1;
  yield 2;
}

(async () => {
  for await (const num of asyncGenerator()) {
    console.log(num);
  }
})();

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Root Certificates in Node.js Crypto Module
DESCRIPTION: Updates the root certificates in the Node.js crypto module to NSS 3.107.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
crypto.update(rootCertificates, 'NSS 3.107');

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including Network Interfaces in Diagnostic Reports
DESCRIPTION: The diagnostic report now includes information about network interfaces.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const report = process.report.getReport();
console.log(report.networkInterfaces);

----------------------------------------

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Old response:
// [{ ... }]

// New response:
// { ... }

TITLE: Updating npm to version 8.1.2
DESCRIPTION: The npm package manager is upgraded to version 8.1.2 in this Node.js release.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
"deps": upgrade npm to 8.1.2 (npm team) [#40643]

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making tab size configurable in readline
DESCRIPTION: Adds ability to configure tab size in the readline module

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const readline = require('readline');
const rl = readline.createInterface({
  input: process.stdin,
  output: process.stdout,
  tabSize: 4
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Querying DNS with 'all' option in io.js 1.2.0
DESCRIPTION: The dns.lookup() method now supports an 'all' boolean option. When set to true, it returns an array of all resolved names for an address.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
dns.lookup(hostname, { all: true }, (err, addresses) => {
  // addresses is now an array of all resolved names
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Node.js Options with JSON Config File
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new experimental config file feature to specify Node.js options in a JSON format. This allows defining test coverage thresholds and other options without passing them as command line flags.

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
{
  "$schema": "https://nodejs.org/dist/v23.10.0/docs/node-config-schema.json",
  "nodeOptions": {
    "test-coverage-lines": 80,
    "test-coverage-branches": 60
  }
}

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Increasing maxmem Range for Crypto Operations
DESCRIPTION: The maximum memory limit for crypto operations has been increased from 32 bits to 53 bits.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
crypto.scrypt('password', 'salt', 64, { maxmem: Math.pow(2, 53) - 1 });

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Mocking Object Method with Node.js Test Runner
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the new mocking functionality in the Node.js test runner to spy on an object method.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
test('spies on an object method', t => {
  const number = {
    value: 5,
    add(a) {
      return this.value + a;
    },
  };
  t.mock.method(number, 'add');

  assert.strictEqual(number.add(3), 8);
  assert.strictEqual(number.add.mock.calls.length, 1);
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating npm to 9.3.1 in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: The npm package manager has been updated to version 9.3.1 in this Node.js release. This update includes breaking changes related to engines, filesystem, auth, login, tarball packing, and other areas.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Example of new npm behavior
npm.commands.install(['package-name'], function(err) {
  // Handle installation
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Vulnerability Check for Node.js in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command uses the 'is-my-node-vulnerable' tool to check if the current Node.js version has any known vulnerabilities or is an End-of-Life version. It helps users identify if they need to upgrade their Node.js installation.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
npx is-my-node-vulnerable

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding experimental support for Ed25519 and Ed448 to crypto module
DESCRIPTION: Adds experimental support for Ed25519 and Ed448 elliptic curve cryptography algorithms to the crypto module.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const crypto = require('crypto');

// Generate Ed25519 key pair
const { publicKey, privateKey } = crypto.generateKeyPairSync('ed25519');

// Sign and verify with Ed25519
const signature = crypto.sign(null, data, privateKey);
const isValid = crypto.verify(null, data, publicKey, signature);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding inspector.waitForDebugger() method
DESCRIPTION: Added a new method to wait for a debugger to attach before starting execution.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const inspector = require('inspector');
inspector.waitForDebugger();

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Global Module Search Paths
DESCRIPTION: Adds --no-global-search-paths command line option to prevent searching for modules in global paths like $HOME/.node_modules and $NODE_PATH

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
--no-global-search-paths

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Upgrading npm in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Upgrades the bundled npm version to 6.14.7.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
upgrade npm to 6.14.7

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring HTTP/2 stream and frame limits
DESCRIPTION: Adds options to configure maximum tolerated rejected streams and invalid frames in the HTTP/2 module.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// New options for HTTP/2 server
const http2 = require('http2');
const server = http2.createServer({
  maxSessionRejectedStreams: 10,
  maxSessionInvalidFrames: 1000
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding getCalls and reset methods to assert.CallTracker
DESCRIPTION: Adds new methods getCalls() and reset() to the assert.CallTracker class for improved testing capabilities.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const assert = require('assert');
const tracker = new assert.CallTracker();
// Use new methods
tracker.getCalls();
tracker.reset();

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Node.js Security Version Updates - August 2018
DESCRIPTION: List of affected Node.js versions receiving security updates addressing multiple vulnerabilities including OpenSSL CVE-2018-0732, CVE-2018-0737, CVE-2018-7166, and CVE-2018-12115.

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
Node.js 10.9.0 (Current)
Node.js 8.11.4 (LTS "Carbon")
Node.js 6.14.4 (LTS "Boron")

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using AsyncLocalStorage in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new AsyncLocalStorage API to maintain context across asynchronous operations

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const http = require('http');
const { AsyncLocalStorage } = require('async_hooks');

const asyncLocalStorage = new AsyncLocalStorage();

function logWithId(msg) {
  const id = asyncLocalStorage.getStore();
  console.log(`${id !== undefined ? id : '-'}: `, msg);
}

let idSeq = 0;
http
  .createServer((req, res) => {
    asyncLocalStorage.run(idSeq++, () => {
      logWithId('start');
      // Imagine any chain of async operations here.
      setImmediate(() => {
        logWithId('finish');
        res.end();
      });
    });
  })
  .listen(8080);

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing Deprecated APIs
DESCRIPTION: Several deprecated APIs have been removed, including Intl.v8BreakIterator and the .dispose() method on domains.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// This no longer works in Node.js 9.0.0
const domain = require('domain');
const d = domain.create();
d.dispose(); // Throws error

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing experimental flag from source maps support
DESCRIPTION: The --enable-source-maps flag is no longer marked as experimental, indicating that source maps support is now considered stable.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
node --enable-source-maps app.js

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating V8 code cache after script execution
DESCRIPTION: Modifies the build process to create the V8 code cache after a script is run, improving performance.

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
// Modified V8 code cache creation
v8::Local<v8::Script> script = v8::Script::Compile(context, source).ToLocalChecked();
script->Run(context);
v8::Local<v8::UnboundScript> unbound_script = v8::ScriptCompiler::CompileUnboundScript(
    isolate, &source, v8::ScriptCompiler::kNoCompileOptions).ToLocalChecked();
CreateCodeCache(unbound_script);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating stream error handling
DESCRIPTION: Changes to error handling behavior in streams.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
stream.on('error', (err) => {
  // handle error
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: IO Performance Benchmarks - Node.js v0.8.0 vs v0.6.19
DESCRIPTION: Benchmark comparisons showing significant performance improvements in file read/write operations between Node.js versions 0.8.0 and 0.6.19.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
# io.js

# 0.6.19, writes
Wrote 1024 byte buffers: 19.428793471925395 mB/s
Wrote 4096 byte buffers: 59.737156511350065 mB/s
Wrote 16384 byte buffers: 83.97010664203543 mB/s
Wrote 65536 byte buffers: 97.4184120798831 mB/s

# 0.8.0, writes
Wrote 1024 byte buffers: 61.236987140232706 mB/s +215.19%
Wrote 4096 byte buffers: 109.05125408942203 mB/s +82.55%
Wrote 16384 byte buffers: 182.18254691200585 mB/s +116.96%
Wrote 65536 byte buffers: 181.91740949608877 mB/s +86.74%

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using require() in Inspector Console
DESCRIPTION: The require() function is now available in the inspector console.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// In inspector console:
const fs = require('fs');

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Timeout Option in TLS Connect
DESCRIPTION: tls.connect() now accepts a timeout option analogous to the net.connect() one.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const tls = require('tls');

tls.connect({
  host: 'example.com',
  port: 443,
  timeout: 5000 // 5 seconds
}, () => {
  console.log('Connected');
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding ability to get certificates as X509Certificate objects in tls module
DESCRIPTION: Adds the ability to retrieve TLS certificates as X509Certificate objects in the tls module.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const cert = tlsSocket.getCertificate();
console.log(cert instanceof crypto.X509Certificate);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Package.json Configuration with Test Scripts - JSON
DESCRIPTION: Example package.json configuration showing how to set up test scripts that use locally installed dependencies. Demonstrates how npm automatically adds ./node_modules/.bin to PATH during script execution.

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
{ "name" : "my-program"
, "version" : "1.2.3"
, "dependencies": { "express": "*", "coffee-script": "*" }
, "devDependencies": { "vows": "*" }
, "scripts":
  { "test": "vows test/*.js"
  , "preinstall": "cake build" } }

TITLE: Adding path/posix and path/win32 alias modules
DESCRIPTION: Adds alias modules for the POSIX and Windows-specific implementations of the path module.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const posixPath = require('path/posix');
const winPath = require('path/win32');

console.log(posixPath.sep); // '/'
console.log(winPath.sep); // '\'

----------------------------------------

LANGUAGE: yaml

title: A super cool title
layout: learn
authors: github_username, another_github_username

TITLE: Conditional Logic Based on NODE_ENV in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the problematic use of NODE_ENV to conditionally execute code based on the environment. It shows how developers might use NODE_ENV to differentiate between development, production, and staging environments, which can lead to inconsistent behavior and testing difficulties.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development') {
  // ...
}

if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {
  // ...
}

if (['production', 'staging'].includes(process.env.NODE_ENV)) {
  // ...
}

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling native V8 code coverage output
DESCRIPTION: Native V8 code coverage information can now be output to disk by setting the NODE_V8_COVERAGE environment variable to a directory.

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
NODE_V8_COVERAGE=/path/to/dir node script.js

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Adds an unsubscribe method to non-active diagnostic channel channels in Node.js.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
// Add unsubscribe method to non-active DC channels
[`004eafbebf`] - **(SEMVER-MINOR)** **lib**: add unsubscribe method to non-active DC channels (simon-id) [#40433](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/40433)

TITLE: Importing QUIC Module
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to enable and use experimental QUIC implementation in Node.js 15

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
const { QuicSocket } = require('net');

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using New Assert Match APIs
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates usage of the new experimental assert.match() and assert.doesNotMatch() methods for validating strings against regular expressions

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const assert = require('assert').strict;

assert.match('I will fail', /pass/);
// AssertionError [ERR_ASSERTION]: The input did not match the regular ...

assert.doesNotMatch('I will fail', /fail/);
// AssertionError [ERR_ASSERTION]: The input was expected to not match the ...

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Memory Usage Tracking Script in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: A script that demonstrates memory usage tracking by storing system metrics in a Set data structure. This implementation intentionally creates a memory leak for demonstration purposes.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
// script.mjs

import os from 'node:os';

let len = 1_000_000;
const entries = new Set();

function addEntry() {
  const entry = {
    timestamp: Date.now(),
    memory: os.freemem(),
    totalMemory: os.totalmem(),
    uptime: os.uptime(),
  };

  entries.add(entry);
}

function summary() {
  console.log(`Total: ${entries.size} entries`);
}

// execution
(() => {
  while (len > 0) {
    addEntry();
    process.stdout.write(`~~> ${len} entries to record\r`);
    len--;
  }

  summary();
})();

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Promisified DNS API in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: An experimental promisified version of the dns module is now available. It can be accessed using require('dns').promises.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const dns = require('dns').promises;

// Example usage
dns.lookup('example.com').then((result) => {
  console.log(result);
}).catch((err) => {
  console.error(err);
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating Vulnerable zlib Configuration in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to create a zlib deflate object with a windowBits value of 8, which could crash or throw an exception in vulnerable Node.js versions due to changes in zlib v1.2.9.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
zlib.createDeflateRaw({windowBits: 8})

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Reading Directory Contents in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Shows how filesystem operations like readdir can return different case formats depending on the underlying filesystem. This example demonstrates potential differences between expected and actual results.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
fs.readdir('test')

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node.js on Android using Termux
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the latest available Node.js version using the Termux package manager on Android.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
pkg install nodejs

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Buffer Blob Support
DESCRIPTION: Introduces Blob class to Buffer module for handling binary data

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
// New Blob API support
const blob = new Blob(['Hello World'], { type: 'text/plain' });

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exposing UV_FS_O_FILEMAP flag in fs module
DESCRIPTION: Exposes the UV_FS_O_FILEMAP flag from libuv in the fs module

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const fs = require('fs');
const fd = fs.openSync('file.txt', fs.constants.O_RDONLY | fs.constants.UV_FS_O_FILEMAP);

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding outputLength Option to crypto.createHash
DESCRIPTION: The crypto.createHash method now accepts an outputLength option to specify the desired output length for the hash.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const hash = crypto.createHash('shake256', { outputLength: 256 });

Running at next tick => number 2

TITLE: Installing Node.js with npm on Windows using Chocolatey
DESCRIPTION: This command installs Node.js with npm on Windows using the Chocolatey package manager.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
cinst nodejs.install

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using diagnostics_channel in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new experimental diagnostics_channel module to publish and subscribe to named channels for diagnostics purposes.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const dc = require('diagnostics_channel');
const channel = dc.channel('mysql.query');

MySQL.prototype.query = function query(queryString, values, callback) {
  channel.publish({
    query: queryString,
    host: this.hostname,
  });

  this.doQuery(queryString, values, callback);
};

channel.subscribe(({ query, host }) => {
  console.log(`mysql query to ${host}: ${query}`);
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting CPU Profile Interval in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: New command-line flag to specify the sampling interval for CPU profiles generated with --cpu-prof.

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
node --cpu-prof --cpu-prof-interval=1000 app.js

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extracting Node.js Binary Distribution in Unix
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to unpack a Node.js binary distribution tarball into a destination directory on Unix systems. It uses the tar command with options to extract and strip the top-level directory.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
cd ~/node/ # or /usr/local if you're feeling brave
tar xzvf /path/to/binary.tar.gz --strip=1

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Verifying Node.js v10.21.0 Release Files with SHA256 Checksums

TITLE: Adding t.after() hook to test runner
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new t.after() hook to the test runner for cleanup operations after tests.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const test = require('node:test');

test('my test', async (t) => {
  t.after(() => {
    // Cleanup code here
  });
  
  // Test code here
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing minimal console.group() in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Adds a minimal implementation of console.group() method.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
console.group();

TITLE: Starting Fleet Worker Drone
DESCRIPTION: Command to start a Fleet worker drone that connects to a hub server using the specified address and secret.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
fleet drone --hub=x.x.x.x:7000 --secret=beepboop

TITLE: Setting Coverage Thresholds in Node.js Tests
DESCRIPTION: New command-line flags to set minimum code coverage thresholds for branches, functions, and lines when running tests with the --experimental-test-coverage flag.

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
node --experimental-test-coverage --test-coverage-lines=80 --test-coverage-branches=60 example.js

TITLE: Upgrading npm to Latest Versions
DESCRIPTION: Commands to manually upgrade npm to the latest secure versions without requiring a Node.js update. This addresses the bearer token vulnerability in older npm versions.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
npm install npm@2 -g

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
npm install npm@3 -g

TITLE: V8 Platform Setup
DESCRIPTION: Initialization code for V8 engine platform

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
void InitializeV8Platform() {
  platform_ = v8::Platform::CreateDefaultPlatform();
  v8::V8::InitializePlatform(platform_);
  v8::V8::Initialize();
}

TITLE: Adding createHistogram() method to perf_hooks module
DESCRIPTION: Introduces a new createHistogram() method in the perf_hooks module for creating performance measurement histograms.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const { createHistogram } = require('perf_hooks');
const histogram = createHistogram();
histogram.record(150);

TITLE: Generating asymmetric key pairs in Node.js crypto module
DESCRIPTION: Added an API for asymmetric key pair generation. The new methods crypto.generateKeyPair and crypto.generateKeyPairSync can be used to generate public and private key pairs. The API supports RSA, DSA and EC and a variety of key encodings (both PEM and DER).

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const { generateKeyPair } = require('crypto');

generateKeyPair('rsa', {
  modulusLength: 4096,
  publicKeyEncoding: {
    type: 'spki',
    format: 'pem'
  },
  privateKeyEncoding: {
    type: 'pkcs8',
    format: 'pem'
  }
}, (err, publicKey, privateKey) => {
  // Handle keys
});

----------------------------------------

napi_value MyAsyncFunction(napi_env env, napi_callback_info info) {
  // Implementation using new async N-API
}

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Buffer without new in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Calling Buffer without new is now deprecated and will emit a process warning. This change improves security by preventing accidental creation of uninitialized buffers.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
Buffer('abc'); // Deprecated, will emit warning
new Buffer('abc'); // Correct usage

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Node.js Blog Post Frontmatter
DESCRIPTION: YAML frontmatter for a Node.js blog post containing metadata like date, category, title, layout, and author information.

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
---
date: '2015-11-20T12:00:00.000Z'
category: weekly
title: Weekly Update - Nov 20th, 2015
layout: blog-post
author: 'Minwoo Jung (@jmwsoft)'
---

----------------------------------------

TITLE: TLS Default Version Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Updates TLS configuration to disable TLS v1.0 and v1.1 by default and enable TLS v1.3 support

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const tls = require('tls');

tls.DEFAULT_MIN_VERSION = 'TLSv1.2';
tls.DEFAULT_MAX_VERSION = 'TLSv1.3';

TITLE: Displaying SHA Checksums for Node.js v0.8.11 Release Files
DESCRIPTION: This code block shows the SHA checksums for various Node.js v0.8.11 release files, including binaries for different platforms and installer packages. These checksums can be used to verify the integrity of downloaded files.

TITLE: Configuring stdio for child processes
DESCRIPTION: Forked child processes and cluster workers now support stdio configuration.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const child = fork('child.js', [], { stdio: 'inherit' });

TITLE: SHA Sums for Node.js v0.8.4 Release Files
DESCRIPTION: This code block provides SHA sums for various Node.js v0.8.4 release files, including installers, executables, and npm packages. These checksums can be used to verify the integrity of downloaded files.

LANGUAGE: markdown

DESCRIPTION: Adds a new tlsSocket.getProtocol() method to get the negotiated TLS protocol version of the current connection.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const tlsSocket = tls.connect(options);
console.log(tlsSocket.getProtocol()); // e.g. 'TLSv1.2'

DESCRIPTION: Command to start a Node.js application with perf profiling enabled using the --perf-basic-prof-only-functions flag

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
# Launch the application an get the PID
$ node --perf-basic-prof-only-functions index.js &
[1] 3870

TITLE: Mocking Modules and Units in Node.js Tests
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Node.js test runner's mock functionality to mock modules and units in tests.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
import assert from 'node:assert/strict';
import { before, describe, it, mock } from 'node:test';

describe('foo', { concurrency: true }, () => {
  let barMock = mock.fn();
  let foo;

  before(async () => {
    const barNamedExports = await import('./bar.mjs')
      // discard the original default export
      .then(({ default: _, ...rest }) => rest);

    // It's usually not necessary to manually call restore() after each
    // nor reset() after all (node does this automatically).
    mock.module('./bar.mjs', {
      defaultExport: barMock,
      // Keep the other exports that you don't want to mock.
      namedExports: barNamedExports,
    });

    // This MUST be a dynamic import because that is the only way to ensure the
    // import starts after the mock has been set up.
    ({ foo } = await import('./foo.mjs'));
  });

  it('should do the thing', () => {
    barMock.mockImplementationOnce(function bar_mock() {
      /* … */
    });

    assert.equal(foo(), 42);
  });
});

----------------------------------------

    "outDir": "./",

TITLE: Demangling C++ Symbols in DTrace Output
DESCRIPTION: This command uses c++filt to demangle C++ symbols in the DTrace output, creating a new file 'demangled.out' which can then be used to create the flame graph.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
c++filt < stacks.out > demangled.out

TITLE: Updating package.json for Type Declaration Generation
DESCRIPTION: Adds a 'prepack' script to generate type declarations before publishing the package.

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
{
  "name": "example-ts-pkg",
  "scripts": {
+   "prepack": "tsc",
    "types:check": "tsc --noEmit"
  }
}

TITLE: TypeScript Enum Example Requiring Transformation
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates TypeScript code using an enum, which requires the --experimental-transform-types flag to run in Node.js.

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
enum MyEnum {
  A,
  B,
}

console.log(MyEnum.A);

TITLE: Limited Serial Execution Pattern in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement serial execution with a limit on the number of operations.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
let successCount = 0;

function final() {
  console.log(`dispatched ${successCount} emails`);
  console.log('finished');
}

function dispatch(recipient, callback) {
  sendMail({
    subject: 'Dinner tonight',
    message: 'We have lots of cabbage on the plate. You coming?',
    smtp: recipient.email,
  }, callback);
}

function sendOneMillionEmailsOnly() {
  getListOfTenMillionGreatEmails(function (err, bigList) {
    if (err) throw err;

    function serial(recipient) {
      if (!recipient || successCount >= 1000000) return final();
      dispatch(recipient, function (_err) {
        if (!_err) successCount += 1;
        serial(bigList.pop());
      });
    }

    serial(bigList.pop());
  });
}

sendOneMillionEmailsOnly();

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extended Synchronous File Read Example
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the execution order in blocking operations where subsequent operations wait for file read completion.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
const fs = require('node:fs');

const data = fs.readFileSync('/file.md'); // blocks here until file is read
console.log(data);
moreWork(); // will run after console.log

TITLE: Adding Unhandled Rejection Warning in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Adds a process warning for unhandled promise rejections after the first tick.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
process.on('unhandledRejection', (reason, promise) => {
  console.log('Unhandled Rejection at:', promise, 'reason:', reason);
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Verifying Node.js v4.4.6 Release File Hashes
DESCRIPTION: PGP signed message containing SHA256 hashes for Node.js v4.4.6 release files. Used to verify the integrity of downloaded installation files.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:

DESCRIPTION: Benchmark comparison between Node.js v0.4.12 and v0.6.0 on Windows systems, demonstrating significant improvements after implementing native Windows support.

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
|                            | v0.4.12 (windows) | v0.6.0 (windows) |
| -------------------------- | ----------------- | ---------------- |
| http_simple.js /bytes/1024 | 3858 r/s          | 5823 r/s         |
| io.js read                 | 12.41 mB/s        | 26.51 mB/s       |
| io.js write                | 12.61 mB/s        | 33.58 mB/s       |
| startup.js                 | 152.81 ms         | 52.04 ms         |

TITLE: Fixing crash when Promise rejection is a Symbol
DESCRIPTION: Fixes an issue where Node.js would crash when a Promise was rejected with a Symbol value.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
Promise.reject(Symbol('foo'))

----------------------------------------

CODE:
import cjs from '../cjs/index.js';

const { a, b, c /* … */ } = cjs;

export { a, b, c /* … */ };

TITLE: Truncating stdout and stderr in child_process
DESCRIPTION: When the maxBuffer option is passed, stdout and stderr will be truncated rather than unavailable in case of an error.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const { exec } = require('child_process');

exec('some command', { maxBuffer: 1024 }, (error, stdout, stderr) => {
  // stdout and stderr will be truncated if they exceed maxBuffer
});

----------------------------------------

CODE:
const { CustomEvent } = require('events');
// Usage of CustomEvent

TITLE: Implementing assert.match() and assert.doesNotMatch()
DESCRIPTION: New assertion methods added to the assert module for matching strings against regular expressions.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
assert.match('test', /^test$/); // Passes
assert.doesNotMatch('test', /fail/); // Passes

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exposing process.features.inspector in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: The process.features.inspector property was exposed.

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
- **process**
  - Exposed `process.features.inspector`. [#25819](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/25378)

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding property flags to GCPerformanceEntry
DESCRIPTION: Adds property flags to the GCPerformanceEntry class in the perf_hooks module

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const { performance, PerformanceObserver } = require('perf_hooks');
const obs = new PerformanceObserver((list) => {
  const entry = list.getEntries()[0];
  console.log(entry.flags);
});
obs.observe({ entryTypes: ['gc'] });

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring HTTP Request Options
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to pass both timeout and agent options to http.request

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
http.request({
  timeout: 1000,
  agent: myAgent
});

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Default Value Option for parsearg - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Added default value option to the parsearg utility for command line argument parsing.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
util.parsearg(options, { default: value })

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding generatePrime and checkPrime to crypto module
DESCRIPTION: Adds new generatePrime and checkPrime methods to the crypto module for generating and checking prime numbers.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
const crypto = require('crypto');

// Generate a prime number
const prime = crypto.generatePrime(1024);

// Check if a number is prime
const isPrime = crypto.checkPrime(prime);

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Node.js Module Registration
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use the new register API for module customization hooks with --import flag

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
node --import ./file-that-calls-register.js ./app.js

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Simplifying ECDH Object Usage in Crypto Module
DESCRIPTION: Simplifies the use of ECDH (Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman) objects with pre-existing private keys. The public key is now computed when explicitly setting a private key.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
crypto.createECDH(curve_name)

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing modules: Add package "imports" field
DESCRIPTION: Added support for the package.json "imports" field (SEMVER-MINOR change). This allows packages to define internal module import mappings.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
{
  "imports": {
    "#dep": {
      "node": "dep-node-native",
      "default": "./dep-polyfill.js"
    }
  }
}

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Allowing Simultaneous -i and -e CLI Flags
DESCRIPTION: Modified Node.js to allow both -i and -e command line flags to be used at the same time.

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
node -i -e "console.log('Hello')"

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Node.js with Custom V8 Snapshot
DESCRIPTION: Example of building Node.js with a custom V8 startup snapshot using the experimental --node-snapshot-main flag

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
$ cd /path/to/node/source

# Specifying an entry point of the snapshot, for example,
# a UMD module like the marked markdown renderer which in
# this case should initialize the renderer and stores in
# globalThis.
$ ./configure --node-snapshot-main=marked.js

# Build the binary
$ make node
